body:
Finishing the encapsulation work started in #25337.

#### Context

We are currently using the address book for different purposes and features in the wallet such us:

1) Store and retrieve own receive addresses with a label.
2) Store and retrieve external addresses with a label.
3) Store and retrieve payment requests.
4) Mark addresses/destinations as 'used' if they appear on the blockchain (part of the âavoid re-useâ feature).
5) Know whether an output is a change or not based on the encoded script.

Some of these points arenât well known by many because this code has been spread and obfuscated across the walletâs sources. (and created in a Frankenstein style).

#### PR Goals

Encapsulate the address book functionalities into its own `AddressBookManager` class, so we are able to distinguish properly the address book responsibilities and capabilities.

Create a new class that can be easily upgraded/replaced, and even different implementations can be used in parallel in different local wallets, by just providing a different manager instance to the wallet in the constructor.

Be able to decouple the address book dependency on the walletâs main mutex (up to a certain point, because we are still using the same db connection).
Clean up the wallet sources further.
And be able to unit/fuzz test the address book manager implementation isolated from the wallet flows.

#### Next steps

After this PR, will be working on improve the âchange outputâ flow which, at least for now, is strictly connected to this process (goal will be to remove the strict dependency).
